definition: to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: Our travel arrangements have been buggered up by the ticket office.
sentences.chinese: 我们的旅行安排被售票处弄糟了。

sentences.english: The box office will notify you as soon as tickets become available.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有票，售票处会立即与您取得联系。

sentences.english: I hurry to the ticket office.
Booking office of Cathay Pacific. May I help you?
sentences.chinese: 国泰航空公司售票处，有什么可以为你效劳吗？

sentences.english: Every faculty and staff member is entitled to one complimentary ticket.
sentences.chinese: 教职员有免费票一张，请自行或找人代至售票处领取。

sentences.english: There are two tickets in my name waiting for you to collect from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 在售票处有两张以我的名字订的票等着你去拿呢。

sentences.english: The booking office usually sells tickets three days in advance.
sentences.chinese: 售票处一般提前三天卖票。

sentences.english: He recalls that there was a long queue outside the ticket office everyday as people lined up to buy tickets.
sentences.chinese: 每一天，买票的人们都在售票处外排起了长队。

sentences.english: Mary:Thank you. Where's the ticket office?
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你，请问售票处在哪儿？

sentences.english: The bad news - it was sold out and the ticket office was closed.
sentences.chinese: 坏消息是，票都卖完了而且售票处已经关门了。

sentences.english: There was a long line of people at the box-office window.
sentences.chinese: 在售票处窗口外排了一长队人。

sentences.english: The booking office usually sells tickes three days in advance.
sentences.chinese: 售票处通常都是提前3天售票。

sentences.english: Just go to the ticket office in the
sentences.chinese: 到地铁的售票处去就行了。

sentences.english: There are notices showing arrivals and departures of trains near the booking-office.
sentences.chinese: 在售票处旁边贴有公告指明火车到站及开出的时间。

sentences.english: Bookable in advance at the box office only with ID.
sentences.chinese: 证可在售票处提前预定。

sentences.english: Some buildings advise patrons to arrive very early to pick up tickets to avoid long lines.
sentences.chinese: 有的售票处建议客人早些到当地取票，以免大排长龙。

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
